website_summaries.verdict: A great game that requires players to follow instructions and develop their logical thinking.
pros: Several difficult levels make it fun for adults and kids

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant idea and an almost perfect design!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm 23, and a graduate student of philosophy. I wanted to buy this cheap looking puzzle as a gift for my nephews. BUT, this is an absolutely fabulous game, I fell in love with it in minutes, completing the puzzles (especially 3-d ones) give an immense pleasure, and the very top level puzzles are not easy at all! I cannot imagine anyone, from an infant to a senior, not being glad for having a Kanoodle! And my first impression is that it would definitely improve the mental skills of young children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 9 year old. He enjoys it, and so have his siblings. They are finding it addictive and don't want to stop solving the puzzles. I've been amazed at how good my 6 year old is with these puzzles. I have really been able to see how spatially gifted (or not) my individual children are with this toy. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 6 Kiddos

customer_reviews.title: Great for a very wide range of ages!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to basketball tournaments to keep my youngest (7yrs, 1st grade) entertained during breaks between games. It has been a hit. I think many of my sons teammates (7th grade) even enjoy it. One of the players siblings (3rd grade) always hangs around and I can tell exactly what he wants. So when I ask do you want to play Kanoodle. It's always YES! Great game for a very wide range of ages.
customer_reviews.author: MinnesotaMom

customer_reviews.title: They loved all of them
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, the IQ fit and the IQ Twist for my grand daughters who are 4 1/2 , 6 1/2 and 8. They loved all of them. Even the littlest one was able to do the simplest of the puzzles. There are levels of difficulty and they were excited about stepping up to the more difficult ones. The IQ fit was great for the 8 year old because it is made up of 3D pieces and is therefore more challenging.
customer_reviews.author: ronni wadler

customer_reviews.title: Educational—but don’t tell them!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very engaging activity for kids & older folks. Grandkids love it! Son & I raced (I bought 2) to see who could solve puzzles faster. This is a fun game no matter your age. Encourages problem solving, practice of spatial relationships, & reading of a diagram. As a former teacher, I see power & benefits to playing the game which far outweigh “game time” —although it works great for just that!!
customer_reviews.author: SE NM Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great motor-processing tool - or game for one person
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for a one-player game. We have an autistic child (high functioning, verbal) who is 4 years behind scholastically, yet many of the things he says are brilliant, so we got him this game and were amazed at how quickly he did the puzzles. These type of games are fantastic at developing motor skills and confidence. We simply opened the booklet for him and he was able to easy follow the diagrams and complete puzzle after puzzle. The pieces are small, but the booklet was easy to read and follow.
customer_reviews.author: Always an adventure

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun single player game from kindergartener to adult
customer_reviews.text: I ALWAYS have 2-3 of these in my closet. It makes a great gift for almost any age and is Hugely popular for any gift exchange. When you give it to a child, their parents steal it and play it at night! It’s fun and stimulating everyone. Great way to reduce screen time but still have fun playing games. Don’t lose any piece though!
customer_reviews.author: worklifekids

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and challenging brain teasing puzzle. We love it and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE Kanoodle! We purchased it thinking it would be a used “once in a while” puzzle. We started using it and the entire family quickly fell in love with it. Our home has a wide age group, 4 years to 49 and we all love it. It’s a durable, engaging puzzle with vibrant colored beads. It gives you a large variety of challenges that always keeps your mind working. We ordered one for our family and loved it so much we ordered one for my Dad. Great for the entire family at a great price. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SCMoose

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter loves it! She's 6!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this! She spends countless hours figuring these little mazes out! And she doesn't get frustrated! She uses problem solving, which is a important skill many people lack these days! Perfect little mind teaser! Get it! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Mama

customer_reviews.title: The problem with this game is...I only have one for 25 students.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my 5th grade classroom. My students LOVE this game. It keeps them engaged in problem solving for an extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: texleprechaun

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Opened our Kanoodle on a road trip and one of the green pieces was missing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this brain teaser
customer_reviews.text: CONTEXT My sister-in-law had this at her house and before she taught me what it was I did not understand it at all. PROS - LOVE that the size of this is so compact. Honestly, so great for traveling! - The puzzles are so fun! In the beginning, you can't wait until you get to the hard stuff... but you just wait! CONS - I bought this version with the 3d puzzle... I tried to do ONE, but the layout is SO CONFUSING. I am not sure if I will ever be able to do it. OVERALL Love this game and highly recommend it. We are slowly getting through the puzzles and I dread the day that we do!
customer_reviews.author: Jilly P

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, educational game!
customer_reviews.text: My family really enjoys visual and pattern puzzles. This game fits this category. There is a little book that presents a series of increasingly difficult puzzles, starting with super easy puzzles for very young children all the way to 3-D puzzles (which we haven't tried yet). We think it was initially designed to be a one-person game, but we ended up "competing" with one another by timing how long it takes each competitor to complete an individual puzzle. Because the game is very small (about 3" x 6"), it's very portable. You just do not want to lose the little puzzle book that accompanies the actual puzzle!
customer_reviews.author: voila viola

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how much my five year old son is enthralled with this game. I had bought it for his older sister and really thought it would be above his level. Out of our hundreds of toys and games this is his “go-to” toy. He can sit and do it on his own for hours on end. And while it is challenging, it does not get him frustrated. I wish I had dozens of toys that could keep his interest as well as kanoodle. Extra bonus that it’s good for his brain development!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: fun game for everybody
customer_reviews.text: i got this game for my grandchildren but i enjoy it as much as they do. it starts out easy but gets a little more difficult with each phase. i think i may get the bigger set. our 5 yr old grandson really likes it as it helps him to concentrate and do logic reasoning. My other grandchildren are young teenagers and haven't tried it yet. i believe they will like it too. i think it will keep them off the game devices for a little while and use their brain for better things. :)
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family and packs nicely for travel
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old daughter loved this game. It can be very challenging (enough for adults) or very easy to make it suitable for kids. For example, the puzzle can be just lacking 1-2 pieces. Or nearly the entire board needs to be completed. I bought it as a travel game and it works great. It is not ideal for playing in the car due to the pieces can fall if they are careful. But it is great to pack up into a bag of toys and play when you get to your destination. I would imagine that the puzzles could be done over and over because it seems unlikely you would remember how it went together in prior games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too easy
customer_reviews.text: After reading the many reviews for this product, I figured it would be a great challenge for my 11 year old daughter who really enjoys puzzles and games. The problem is that the puzzles are way too easy. My daughter breezed through the hardest 3D pyramid puzzles, only taking a minute of two for each one. It seems the puzzle guide tells you exactly where to place all but one or two pieces in the 3D challenges so it really is not challenging at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: Great one person game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game that teaches problem solving, following instructions and understanding diagrams. The object is to arrange the pieces in the grid to match the image and then figure out where the remaining pieces go. There are 2D games where the pieces lay flat in a rectangular grid and 3D games where the pieces are arranged into a pyramid. There are puzzles for all kids' skill levels. I as an adult found the most difficult ones slightly challenging but was able to solve them.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: GT kiddo loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my GT (Gifted and Talented) nephew. Due to his high IQ he is very imaginative and gets bored of things quickly. I put this in his Easter basket because it’s small size, when he opened it, he played with it for almost an hour straight. My sister also loved it because they can take it on car rides or inside restaurants while they wait on food.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME toy to challenge the kid (and me)
customer_reviews.text: My kid (8) is a terd if he isn't being challenged academically. I bought this for him because it is small and he can carry it with him and use it in class when he finishes his work early without much distraction, and he can do it at home on days school was too easy to keep him from starting fights with his sister. He figured it out quickly and has found ways to keep challenging himself. When he is asleep or playing with other things, I also enjoy figuring out the puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: je

customer_reviews.title: High quality game, but too easy for an 8-year old
customer_reviews.text: My son played in backward order of the 200 levels. He solved them all in a half day and got bored immediately. I guess this is good for younger kids. He now asks for the "extreme" edition of the game.
customer_reviews.author: JessC

customer_reviews.title: Hours of endless entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this would really be THAT entertaining, but wow! My 8 year old is captivated by this when he opens it. He received it as a gift on Christmas and he spent nearly all of his free time that day completing puzzles. He has played with it daily and is sure to grab it as we head out the door on car rides. I really like that the pieces are connected and can’t come apart. I initially thought it was going to be full of loose parts (sort of like marbles) but am so happy that’s not the case ( we also have a 2 year old and 10 month old running around).
customer_reviews.author: Kirtyb

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety of ages and easy to take on the go!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my 9yo son and he loves it. I was surprised how much his younger siblings - 7 and 4 - like to play with it too! My husband takes a crack at it once in a while as well. The instruction pamphlet has leveled options so that everyone can work to improve at their own pace. It's also nice how compact it is - you can throw it in a backpack, take it on a plane, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Mom

customer_reviews.title: Educational Insights - best customer service ever
customer_reviews.text: Educational Insights Customer service - is just the best customer service ever! My 10 years old son has lost one piece recently and got very upset with this fact as it is one of his favorite puzzle games. I have communicated with the Customer service and described our problem. At first they couldn't find the piece we needed and promised to find a solution asap. In a couple of days they have sent me the missing piece haven't even asked me to pay for the delivery, but definitely made my child happy. Wonderful service, amazing people, great company and a fabulous game!
customer_reviews.author: @rei

customer_reviews.title: The physical product is great, all of the pieces look nice
customer_reviews.text: The physical product is great, all of the pieces look nice, and the case feels good in the hand. But the game ended up being a little lackluster. Setting up the puzzles in the book takes more time than solving them, especially the 3D puzzles. The replay value is minimal, and I don't think we'll end up doing all the puzzles even one time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old grand nephew. He started with the easy ones and them we decided to jump to the hardest 3d pyramid. He was able to follow most of the instructions with a little help and we actually solved it. I have kept the game since his parents do not like toys with small parts since they get lost and are all over the house. I just have to remember to bring it with me when I see him. I recommend it highly. The company website lists replacement parts but it would probably be cheaper to by a new game then to try to order them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M

customer_reviews.title: Definately recommend fun for all ages above 5
customer_reviews.text: I Bought it for a stocking stuffer and my kids enjoyed playing with the puzzles. My seven year old is behind academically but he mastered the triangles right away!! Some of his older siblings did but it took awhile were excited to discover he has a engineering mind!! Gave him a huge confidence boost!! Luv that it keeps them away from the electronics!! The only thing is is once you master all then your done but it's like that with any puzzles. Would reccomend though.
customer_reviews.author: Picky shopper

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it, you won’t regret it
customer_reviews.text: This game... is amazing! My 7 yr old is surprisingly obsessed! He got it for Christmas and has been playing it several times a day for the past week and a half. I highly recommend it for any puzzle, logic game lover. My husband and his brother also played with it several times. My three year old enjoyed play with the pieces even though he couldn’t actually do the puzzle. I started searching for him frantically but found him under the table just working on putting the pieces together for a good 45 mins. Absolutely worth it!! We will be adding more of there puzzle games in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Borrett

customer_reviews.title: For kids and adults alike
customer_reviews.text: My 9 years old sits for hours solving the puzzles.....I decided that if this captivated her for such an extended period of time, then I ought to figure out the dealio ---- this game becomes challenging as you advance in levels. I've become addicted. I have to order another solitary brain game so we both can have our "brain game time".
customer_reviews.author: K.M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I had thought to buy a second set prior to receiving this one, thinking it would be fun if both granddaughters could play at the same time. Glad I didn't--the case and the pieces are much smaller than I expected from the images on the product listing. It certainly would not be a safe toy around a child younger than 3 or 4, as the pieces could be a choking hazard. Also, the case is flimsy, and difficult to close once opened.
customer_reviews.author: M. Estock

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Mind bending fun. Can it compete with a Nintendo? Of course not. But if you involve the kids, it can be rewarding. There are two kinds of puzzles to complete: 2 D puzzles where they are all organized inside the plastic box, and the 3-D pyramid where they sit on a different “platform” at the bottom of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gertrude

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Challenging for kids and adults. One game that will make you think and test your patience. I think it's a great brain developing toy for young kids. My son spends minutes in a row solving the puzzles. It's great to see him doing this and not staring at his computer.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi T.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for younger kids!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great idea for something all 3 kids in their stockings.! The younger 2 played on and off most of Christmas day and managed to get all the flat configurations done and almost all the pyramids completed (13 year old completed all, 10 year old all but a few). I would give it a 5 star if there were a few more advanced pyramids. It seemed as though most of the pages were almost too easy for them to complete.
customer_reviews.author: Razzor

customer_reviews.title: Fun strategic challenging game, my niece loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My niece who is 7 absolutely loves this game! I wasn’t sure it would be such a big hit but with how cheap it was... I was willing to take a chance on getting it for her birthday. She loves anything that involves strategy and this is fun for her but also challenging so she loves the combination. Great gift for kids who like a challenging, strategic, fun “thinking” game.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey

customer_reviews.title: Puzzles for all ages and well made product
customer_reviews.text: Much more difficult than I anticipated, but seriously great for all ages. Starts with puzzles that are as simple as can be: place one piece. And progressively gets harder. The lower levels are obviously too easy for adults, but the expert levels get pretty tough. Small and compact, makes a great stocking stuffer. The case is hard plastic and not flimsy or cheap feeling at all.
customer_reviews.author: G. Z

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Kanoodle is a fun and challenging game that my 7 year old loves. The adults in our family have had fun playing as well. This is a great way to practice problem solving and an engaging, non-electronic independent activity for school aged kids. It’s small enough to take to appointments or doctor visits and could easily be played in the car. Would be a great stocking stuffer or gift!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: Fun teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: We are a family that loves to play games and thisKanoodle is great for the younger ones for a teaching tool
customer_reviews.author: debra garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great, except for one or two bad points
customer_reviews.text: A great puzzle! I've been using the puzzle for about three months now and my second through fifth graders love it. I have purchased 8 of them for my puzzle clubs. The colors in the puzzle booklet correspond to some extent with the color of the puzzle pieces, but it could be much better--this is the only thing the kids have a problem with. The writing in the booklet uses black letters on a dark blue background and black letters on a dark purple background, making it difficult to impossible to read. White letters would have been better. However, this doesn't seem to present a problem for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: DonV

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this intending to use it as a stocking stuffer for Christmas. I intended to only play it a few times before giving it away. What is it they say about good intentions? I haven't quit playing with this thing since then and now I have ordered the Kanoodle Extreme. This puzzle game is definitely not just for children. I'm 60.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: What a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly didn't even know what this was - my son put it on my grandson's Christmas wish list, but once it was opened and we figured out how to play, the adults wouldn't leave it alone! I plan on buying more of these. It's nice to see kids playing with something that uses their brain without being glued to the tv or a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda in TX

customer_reviews.title: It addicting and challenging
customer_reviews.text: It comes with 12 pieces in different colors, with unlimited challenges. The pieces won't roll around; it's best to work on a flat surface. Follow the diagrams, not the colors, and you'll have hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: waiting in doctor's offices gets pretty boring. This game is small enough to carry ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we are in doctor's offices every week with my 7 year old, and as you can imagine, waiting in doctor's offices gets pretty boring. This game is small enough to carry in my purse, and sturdy enough that he can do it on his lap. My 7 year old LOVES it, and I'd much rather him do this than play on my phone while waiting at his doctor's office. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: PamW

customer_reviews.title: fun, easy or challenging, you choose! good for all ages kids to elderly
customer_reviews.text: Just opened ours, and immediately enjoyed a few of the mid level puzzles - I think the harder ones will really challenge me. This will be a great little quick entertainment for killing a few minutes. Perfect coffee table game for anyone to pick up and fiddle with. Going to buy some for stocking stuffers as it's great for any age and compact enough for traveling, too. I think my 86 yr old mom will love solving these puzzles, great for her brain and hands, and I bet she solves some of these faster than I will.
customer_reviews.author: TZ2DSR

customer_reviews.title: Great game for your puzzler (adult or kid) for travel or home
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old can't stop playing with this and she can do the genius ones when the adults in our family cannot. It's a lot of fun for people of all ages and fits nicely in the container so it's great for travel. I'm so happy we got this - we're using it all the time and so much more than I ever could have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Just listen

customer_reviews.title: A Great Puzzle with Many Different Configurations
customer_reviews.text: sWe picked one of these up for our granddaughters to play with when they are at our house, and they love it. So, we purchased another for our middle granddaughter for her 7th birthday. She was so excited to get her own Kanoodle. She loves this game/educational thinkers puzzle and spends a lot of time working the many puzzles. The 3D puzzle configurations are especially challenging, but they like the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift for a high schooler...
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what to buy my nephew who is at that High School age and I'm 68. What do I know about what a teenager would like. Well I solved that problem, I was occupied for the rest of the day playing by/with himself. I can tell the only thing he would have enjoyed was a sex toy. & I don't care to get into that with his parents..
customer_reviews.author: just Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 10 y/o
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my 10 y/o niece as part of a camp care package. She Loves it! It might be a bit difficult for her at this age, I didn't realize there was a Junior version, but still she really enjoys the challenge. It occupies her, it travels well, it's educational and helps develop spacial relations. Overall quality game that I'm really glad I purchased for her.
customer_reviews.author: Novel Addict

customer_reviews.title: Teachers! Put this in your classroom!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this "game", my students of this "game" and it's hilarious to watch adults play this "game". Teachers put this in your classroom if you don't have some already. I've taught fourth and fifth grade and both grade levels really enjoy this. they think they are playing a game and don't realize that they're using problem solving skills and strategy!
customer_reviews.author: Mom! Teacher! Shopper!

customer_reviews.title: Great for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: My 6 yo son loved this on a recent road trip. It consumed him for over an hour. I love to find activities for my kids to do on long drives that isn’t always staring at a screen, and this did exactly that. It’s great for all ages even if they aren’t completing the designs. My kid’s cousins of all ages were wanting to try it. Fun for adults too!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle for young minds
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 6 year old, she absolutely loves it. Puzzles start very easy and get progressively harder. The more difficult ones she really has to use some critical thinking skills. Have used at home, in the car, waiting at the dentist/for takeout, etc. Easy to toss in my purse and take with us everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: no mess
customer_reviews.text: This is a great time passer for kids with no mess and makes my child think a little. He loves it and now wants the other games like it. I think it is a great break from the tv and video games. Just love it and I highly recommend it for any and all families that has a child or anyone that likes a little bit of thinking fun. It will do them great, and it is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and intelligent game
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Kids enjoy this intelligent game. It's size is like a handy/pocket type toy, and they can play it during travel. The quality of each component is good, without plastic odor. The reason why I give this product 4 stars is that the manual book (with level quizzes inside) is too small. I'm afraid that kids' eyes get tired after long time play.
customer_reviews.author: YK

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: As a homeschooling momma that spends a ton of time in waiting rooms. This game is one of our grab and goes. My kids love it. They play with it all the time, and its what I was looking for, I don't often let my kiddos use electronics. I needed something that was portable and would entertain all of them 11,9 and 6. This fits the bill! I highly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: R. Suazo

customer_reviews.title: Fun and entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: My kids both love this (ages 8 and 12). They find some of the puzzles easy and some more challenging, but even the easy ones I see them do over and over. We have taken it while traveling as well. All pieces and the book fit in the container so no lost pieces. My 8 year old who has ADHD can sit and do this for a pretty long period of time and it keeps his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: We just got this game yesterday and can't put it down. It's really interesting for adults as well. Can't stop doing the 3D puzzles. My boys loved it as well. The game is great to develop spatial thinking. It's very small and portable, which is another plus. It's definitely worth to get.
customer_reviews.author: DadOf2Boys

customer_reviews.title: Fun puzzle
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 10 yo niece. The puzzle set comes in its own case so easy to travel with. There are many different puzzles to solve, both 2D and 3D. Fun to play alone or with others. I think this is a great gift for kids to build problem solving skills and improve concentration.
customer_reviews.author: Mairead

customer_reviews.title: It's sure to be a hit!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little game. It's super fun and can get competitive. It has different skill levels so it works for younger kids but I think it's best for 8 and up it's also really fun for teens. It's very compact you can fit it into a backpack pocket or into a Christmas stocking easily. It's really a wonder game for anyone who likes puzzle games. It's a fast game played in under five minutes. This game has lots of replay ability. It's a fun game a worth the few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Moore

customer_reviews.title: A must have item
customer_reviews.text: This has been a staple in our house for many years. It will fit nicely in a backpack, laptop bag, or purse. We have used these to entertain ourselves and our kids while waiting in restaurants, or doctor appointments. The puzzles start off easy and then gradually increase in difficulty. This is definitely a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Hal J.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson 10 years old. Haven’t given it to him yet so don’t know if he’ll like it. It came in a 8x12 box. When I got game out of Such a large box I was surprised I could hold this game in the palm of my hand. I have a small hand. I’m afraid it’s not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Addictive!! :)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a stocking stuffer & really wasn’t sure what it was. I saw that it was educational & figured I couldn’t go wrong. Let me tell you how awesome this game is! I love that it makes you use your brain! I recommend this, both as a parent and a teacher. (This would be a great inside recess game or learning center for 2nd/3rd grade & up!!) The 3-D puzzles are addictive!
customer_reviews.author: MDett79

customer_reviews.title: Lost the paper with the puzzles. Now what?
customer_reviews.text: This game was a hit with kids and adults alike at my campground. Fun to complete. BUT my daughter already misplaced the pamphlet with the puzzles in it. I wish it was attached somehow to the container. A magnet or something. We can’t use it now bc we don’t have the puzzles :/
customer_reviews.author: allison

customer_reviews.title: Great for Family!
customer_reviews.text: A bit bummed. The pic of the pyramid made it looking these are magnetic. My Husband and Daughter are loving all of the designs it shows how to make in the booklet! Im not good at puzzles/brain teasers but they enjoy them and they really enjoy Kanoodle so Im happy!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for myself as an adult and I think it’s the best! I just love puzzles and this is one of my favourites. I leave it on the coffee table and you’d be surprised how many people pick it up and start playing while in my house, all adults too!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun for All Ages!
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this as a brain stimulating game for my twin 6 year-olds, but have enjoyed it just as much! The concept is great! Nice compact item, with plenty of punch. The pieces store nicely inside with the suggested games and instructions - fully mobile. A plethora of puzzles are provided and once you're ready to up the game...go 3D! Having a blast playing with my kiddos and timing how quickly each can complete. Great purchase! (Side note: just don't lose a "noodle"!)
customer_reviews.author: JessKrep

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for your kids or a gift!
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic! All parts store inside the box, so I don't have to worry as much about my kids losing them. My 5 yr old, 7 yr old and 10 yr old all find it entertaining. It's small, portable, gift able.... Great idea! My son keeps taking it to
customer_reviews.author: B.C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Challenging for All Ages
customer_reviews.text: Fun for all ages. My 84 year old dad enjoys the challenge of the various puzzles and my 8 year old son just sat for an hour solving and working to solve a puzzle. It comes with a book of challenges that includes several levels of difficulty. 3D options available too.
customer_reviews.author: Versatile Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! First day and he sat for 2 hours straight! No tv or technology and just kept working on these puzzles and coming up with some of his own. This is an awesome item and I would recommend. Not a ton of pieces to keep track of as the little balls are connected. Great challenge. I enjoyed this myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun; smaller than i imagined
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty fun, good game to take a break from all the screens I should've paid more attention to the dimensions because it's smaller than i imagined, so just watch out because the instructions is a small booklet (not faulting the manufacturer, just sharing my experience) i guess it's good for "travel size"
customer_reviews.author: ISometimesUseAmazon

customer_reviews.title: This is a great puzzle item.
customer_reviews.text: It's really interesting and works fine. Would not recommend for little kids, there are a lot of little pieces. My almost 7 year old granddaughter can do the 'genius' ones, so I'm not sure if it's hard enough for adults, but it's a very neat little item. Would recommend if you have a child or adult that likes to figure out puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice little puzzle. Get more than one for variety.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small puzzle in a tiny little box for children on road trips . I might order more. Short attention span. Not the puzzles fault . Needs more variety . That’s fine. Affordable. If you don’t lose the pieces it could last indefinitely . Good build quality
customer_reviews.author: W.Burke W. II

customer_reviews.title: Brain Teaser
customer_reviews.text: My kids (11, 15, 17) and husband enjoyed this puzzle. They each spent several hours going through the puzzle variations. Now that they've completed the booklet they've lost interest. I could see this puzzle lasting longer for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating!
customer_reviews.text: Our seven year old granddaughter could not put this down! She worked through the entire puzzle instruction booklet. It was challenging, but not frustrating. She would up taking it home! Pleased to have been able to please! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: WJC

customer_reviews.title: Fun puzzles for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I enjoyed the Kanoodle puzzle. My kids had fun solving the puzzles and were so happy to figure out the more challenging puzzles. I found some of the 3-D puzzles challenging as well. The game is nice and compact and we brought it to a road trip. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good but only 36 actually challenging configurations
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy solving puzzles, and do so on a semi regular basis, then it probably wont be challenging until the last 36 of the 200 configurations. Since setting the starting 24 takes longer than the actual solution, I recommend you save yourself the hassle and skip them. That being said, Kanoodle is definetly fun, versatile, requieres no electricity, and is well made. Although it left me wishing it was more challenging, I might have just missed that it's targeting a younger demographic than a 27 year old. There's also other versions that appear to be harder, so I would definitely buy those.
customer_reviews.author: Brian X. León Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great thinking toy. My daughters both 6 and 9 enjoy it (I may even steal it sometimes and play for awhile! The case it comes in is very sturdy and can fit in your purse easily to pull out whenever needed(waiting rooms, waiting for siblings at practice, etc) Not sure if I didn’t pay close attention when I bought but I didn’t realize that these are all different shapes not individual balls. Much less to worry about with losing pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me by a fellow parent. We've had fun with it. It has plenty of different levels, and is easy to chuck in a backpack or purse and pull out in the car or at a restaurant. Great value for the price. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JAR1599

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I got for a 9 year old, and helped him play a few rounds till he got the hang of it. There are multiple puzzles to do at each level. I like that it also has the 3D puzzles, which will keep him interested. Will definitely gift again in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves these kinds of puzzle/games. I use to babysit a bit who had this puzzle and my son was obsessed with it and played every time we were at their house. So finally found it on Amazon and bought him his own. He can spend a good amount of time playing with this little puzzle.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: nice puzzle
customer_reviews.text: my 8yo niece really liked this puzzle especially because the solutions were not given. so if you can't figure it out, well, you just have to keep trying!! The 3D puzzles were very nice too. I like that they ramp up the difficulty from 1 piece out to 5-6 pieces out. Good game for various age groups.
customer_reviews.author: Ramkumar

customer_reviews.title: it is interesting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father-in-law who is having some memory issues, I have not given it to him yet, but I did open it and tried it out. It is fun!! It is pocket size, I guess I thought it would be a little larger. I am certain it will be used.
customer_reviews.author: nicoleb

customer_reviews.title: Kept my daughter busy for hours
customer_reviews.text: This educational toy is giftable, durable, educational and so much fun. It’s also travel friendly because the case fits everything so nicely. It’s been so many months since we bought this and my daughter still enjoys it. She has even come up with her own combinations. I would definitely recommend for 8-10 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Aamir Bashir

customer_reviews.title: Good fun - can play alone or together
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! Bought this as a gift and when the family got together we all played around the table. The puzzle book is great with different levels to challenge everyone!! Definitely worth the money and can help stimulate the brain.
customer_reviews.author: JenMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Delivered missing items
customer_reviews.text: The game looks awesome but is was delivered without puzzle book making it nearly useless for my son
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Not what is pictured
customer_reviews.text: It looked much bigger in the picture. It's half the size of a small pencil box for elementary school and can fit inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: someone08

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift! I bought it for my husband, and he and all 6 of my kids love it!!!! They play out all the time, I may buy a couple more so more people can play at the same time, or speed challenges! Very compact for easy travel. I just wish it has a backup section to hold the pieces while you are solving puzzles or store it if you have to interrupt your game. Would be great stocking stuffers!
customer_reviews.author: the7smiths

customer_reviews.title: Multi uses and multi age uses
customer_reviews.text: Kids love this game, helps stimulate reasoning, problem solving and great for mindfulness. I work frequently with my 5 year on and with my (therapy) clients to help them focus and regain emotional control and teach clients distress tolerance at times. Multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: A mind puzzle that fis in your pocket
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little mind puzzle. This game is small enough to fit in your pocket. The case holds closed tightly and holds all the pieces and directions. I don't like that the puzzle pictures included are very tiny and difficult to track because the are so many.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi and Jay

customer_reviews.title: A Christmas Highlight
customer_reviews.text: Really, everyone in the family loved playing with this. From 8 year olds to grandparents. There are 2 D and 3D puzzles to solve. The parts are durable, and it packs easily. Great for the car too.
customer_reviews.author: M&PK

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game! It's small enough to fit in my purse to take anywhere. Great for entertaining kids while out at a restaurant or on a plane or anywhere else. My husband and I even enjoy playing. To challenge us more we time how long it takes to finish the puzzle. The winner is the one with the fastest time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than shown
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has to stop blowing up photos of products making them look larger than they are. This fits in the palm of my hand. Ridiculous-not worth the money. Instead of a gift I'm putting this in as stocking stuffer. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boop

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a stocking stuffer for my 10 year old son and I don't know who loves it more - him or me! There are so many different puzzles and levels so it never gets boring. Highly recommend this for anyone! Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Kanoodle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6-year-old son originally. But it turned out that I liked the game more than he does 😂 The 2D levels 4/5 and the 3D ones do require some thinking for an adult to get it done. It's a very fun and addictive game.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: Not knowing what to get for my 17yr old nephew with Aspergers I went for this as he doesn’t like getting clothes. I couldn’t believe it but it kept him occupied all of Xmas day instead of him wandering around the house opening doors. What a great little game.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Hill

customer_reviews.title: The kids really enjoyed this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was on sale and I figured it would be nice to have a new indoor thing for the kids to do with all the Rain we have been having. It is kind of a pain to put away but there is a chart so that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Visual Spatial Gold
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful for my students who have visual spatial strengths and is a lot of fun to use with 2nd and 3rd grade students. It kind of appears to be a travel game, and the 2-D puzzles would probably be okay for that kind of use. The 3D pyramids I wouldn't tackle without a nice solid table under the case though.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 5 to 11 year old this is great. I have a 5 and 9 year old who love this!! I just randomly challenge them by picking a puzzle from the book it comes with... my kids love these! Perfect for vacations and long car trips!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony chelotti

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers and adults!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a perfect puzzle game during this quarantine time. My son who is 5 spends so much time doing the easy to moderate levels. He loves it. And this is also a great option for adults in the hard to genius level! It’s absolutely a mind teaser trying to figure it out and relaxing at the same time. We do several puzzles everyday and spend time as family on the table with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: We have another game just like this from Target
customer_reviews.text: We have another game just like this from Target. Bought this because it said there were hundreds of puzzles contained. Disappointed there weren't more three d building challenges. Most were just the 2-D, which are fun, but no different from the IQ game we already had.
customer_reviews.author: Rhoda Keefer

customer_reviews.title: Our Grandson Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old grandson came over with his parents on his birthday and this was one of the presents we gave him. After opening all his presents, he went right back to the Kanoodle and began to play with it. It kept him busy for almost an hour before he even looked at his other opened gifts. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: IRead IWrite

customer_reviews.title: Great simple, but mind-stimulating, game.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my 6 year old after a classmate mentioned it during one of her Zoom meetings. She enjoys it. Can do many by herself. My husband and I like to attempt some of the more challenging ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: MC

product_meta.title: Educational Insights Kanoodle | Brain Twisting 3-D Puzzle Game for Kids, Teens & Adults | Featuring 200 Challenges
product_meta.description:
Style:StandardCan you Kanoodle? Using combinations of colored connected beads, players complete colorful logic puzzles in two unique formats: tricky 2D puzzles and twisted 3D pyramids. To start, pick a design from the puzzle book, place some of the puzzle pieces into position as shown…then fill the empty spaces with the remaining pieces. Sounds simple? It can be…or it can be deviously difficult, depending on the level of game play. Hundreds of possible combinations, but only one completes the puzzle. Puzzle pieces fit inside the handy pocket-sized case with built-in game boards, so you can Kanoodle anywhere. Includes 12 puzzle pieces, 48-page illustrated puzzle book, and carrying case. For 1 player.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Can you Kanoodle? Using combinations of colored connected beads, players complete colorful puzzles in two unique formats: tricky 2D puzzles and twisted 3D pyramids. To start, pick a design from the puzzle book, place some of the puzzle pieces into position as shown…then fill the empty spaces with the remaining pieces. Sounds simple? It can be…or it can be deviously difficult, depending on the level of game play. Hundreds of possible combinations, but only one completes the puzzle. Puzzle pieces fit inside the handy pocket-sized case with built-in game boards, so you can Kanoodle anywhere. Includes 12 puzzle pieces, 48-page illustrated puzzle book, and carrying case. For 1 player.
feature_bullets: OVER 2 MILLION GAMES SOLD! Challenge your noggin with this best-selling, award-winning, brain-twisting, solo game

2-D & 3-D BRAIN-TWISTING PUZZLES: Kanoodle is a puzzle game that includes 12 puzzle pieces, 200 puzzle challenges, a 48-page illustrated puzzle book, and a carrying case. Perfect brain teaser, travel game

INCLUDES 200 PUZZLES! Kanoodle includes 200 logical thinking puzzles from basic to deviously difficult, there are hundreds of possible combinations, but only one correct answer. Perfect for enhancing problem-solving, critical thinking, and strategic thinking skills
MADE FOR ALL AGES: For anyone 8 to 108! Kanoodle is the perfect brain-twisting, puzzle game

AT HOME LEARNING ACTIVITY: Makes a great activity for kids to stay engaged, entertained, and learning outside of the classroom. We are dedicated in providing resources that keep your kids learning and having fun while at home

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,095 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
